text: In chemistry, a dialdose is a monosaccharide containing two aldehyde groups. For example, the hexodialdose O=CH–(CHOH)4–CH=O, obtained by reducing glucose with sodium amalgam. ==References== Sławomir Jarosz (1994): "Synthesis of derivatives of C19 and C21 dialdoses". Tetrahedron Letters, volume 35, issue 41, pages 7655-7658. Franz Gottwalt Fischer, Helmut Schmidt (1960): "D‐gluco‐Hexodialdose". Chemische Berichte, volume 93, issue 3, pages 658-662. Category:Monosaccharides
title: Dialdose
